metadata.Title: CVE-2013-0156 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
active_support/core_ext/hash/conversions.rb in Ruby on Rails before 2.3.15,3.0.x before 3.0.19, 3.1.x before 3.1.10, and 3.2.x before 3.2.11 does notproperly restrict casts of string values, which allows remote attackers toconduct object-injection attacks and execute arbitrary code, or cause adenial of service (memory and CPU consumption) involving nested XML entityreferences, by leveraging Action Pack support for (1) YAML type conversionor (2) Symbol type conversion.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0156` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ruby-activesupport-3.2 - 3.2.6-5
No subscription required

libextlib-ruby - 0.9.15-3
libextlib-ruby1.8 - 0.9.15-3
libextlib-ruby1.9.1 - 0.9.15-3
ruby-extlib - 0.9.15-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby-activesupport-3.2 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.6-5').
ruby-extlib package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.15-3').
